question: Oliver has a bag of buttons with 44 inside. He tripped over a stick while carrying it and dropped one quarter of them. He scrambled to search for them but only came up with 7. When he went back home, he inspected the buttons further. Four of the ones he picked up weren't buttons, but actually beads so he got rid of them. How many buttons did Oliver end up with?
answer:
Oliver dropped his buttons and was left with 44*3/4=<<44*3/4=33>>33 buttons.
He searched and found some of his lost buttons, getting him back to 33+7=<<33+7=40>>40 buttons.
He went home and removed four beads, leaving him with 40-4=<<40-4=36>>36 buttons.
#### 36
